page.title: 02Iron County of Sussex
page.content: Natural elements in the area used for various industrial purposes. The Forest area is mostly deciduous, and the abundance of trees provided fuel for the furnaces of the Iron Masters in Country The Hammer Ponds were so named because water flowing from them was diveretd to work the machinery for the Hammers used for breaking up of Iron stone dug from local pits. The iron was used to produce guns,firebacks and tomb stones, the railings first made for St Pauls were cast in Sussex and the horse shoes used by the Cavalry were made in local area of Roffey. Grassland and farmland coverd quite big areas and agricultural produce was most probably more abundant than that of the industrial projects. Now many Garden Centres continue this trend..
